plugins.name: Design Board
plugins.description:
What

Interior designers use 3D/2D elevation renderings with callouts to specific design materials used. It's tedious to add the layout and then add the callouts, while keeping track of what materials are being used for specific clients.


How

Design board provides a way to simplify this workflow.

  1. Sync master list of items from google sheets
  2. Add/update/delete items from plugin (keeps sheet in sync)
  3. Choose items to add to layout
  4. Save active items back to sheets


Get started

  1. Clone the sheets template from sample sheet. The spreadsheet needs to have sheets named master and active to read/write items.
  2. Use https://designboard.destinationeichler.com/ to login and get credentials for google sheets access
  3. Login to plugin using the credentials and view your master items.
  4. Use a card template from this sample figma design. The elements in the template card need to be named as name, desc, qty-val, price-val, cost-val, img


NOTE - If you don't want to set up a sheet, use mock as the token name and the plugin will load with some test data.


Contact

Reach out to the team for bug fixes, feature requests use this form.
plugins.tagline: Integrate Google sheets with Figma for common Interior design workflows

Smart Route empowers you to effortlessly connect frames with fully customizable links. plugins.name: Drafito
plugins.description:
Import web pages into Figma for free, converting them into editable design drafts.


The current version is a beta version and may have various issues. Feel free to use and provide feedback.


How to convert a web page to a Figma design file:


1、Install the Chrome extension.

2、Visit the webpage you want to import.

3、Click the extension icon, select "Export Page" or "Select Element" to export as JSON.

4、Open your Figma design file and run the Draftito plugin.

5、Import the downloaded design JSON data.

plugins.name: AI Content Filler
plugins.description:
AI Content Filler is a content generation plugin based on GPT and DALL·E. It uses layer names as prompts to generate text or images. Simply name the layers appropriately, then select multiple layers to generate content with a single click. You can also use grouping to ensure consistency of the generated content.


Features

  • Layer names as prompts: Generate any type of content and customize the format, length, style, etc.
  • Quick generation: Generate multiple texts and images with one click.
  • Context grouping: Ensure consistency of the generated texts and images.
  • Free to use: Use your own OpenAI API Key without additional charges.


How to use

  • (1) Input your OpenAI API key. If you don't have one yet, you can get one from https://platform.openai.com.
  • (2) Rename the layer or group to which you want to apply the AI-generated content, starting with [ai]. For example,
 + Frame: [ai] user profile
 | - Shape: [ai] avatar photo
 | - Text:  [ai] username, at least 4 characters
 | - Text:  [ai] email address
  • (3) Select one or multiple renamed layers or groups.
  • (4) Click the "Generate and Fill" button at the bottom of the plugin panel.


Remember to experiment and explore the capabilities of the AI Content Filler plugin to maximize its potential and streamline your design workflow.
plugins.tagline: Generate and Fill multiple texts and image in one click

plugins.name: CSS Variables
plugins.description:
CSS Variables


Import

  • Variables can be imported into Figma either as a new collection or existing collection can be updated.
  • Almost all the CSS color units are supported.
  • Only px, in, cm, mm, pt, pc and rem length units are supported. And for the rem unit, the default font size 16px is used for conversion.
  • The variables other than color and length units are silently ignored.


Export

  • Multiple modes can be exported at once from Figma.
  • The color units can be exported in one of the following spaces, sRGB(hex, rgb, hsl, hwb), CIELAB(lab, lch), Oklab, Oklch, display-p3.
  • Number unit can be exported either as pixel(px) or rem.
  • Also there's an option to preserve the alias.

accepted.name: mohan vadivel
accepted.description: Product Designer

plugins.tagline: A utility tool for importing and exporting variables between CSS and Figma.

plugins.name: MonoMagic: Desaturate Frames & Vectors
plugins.description:
True Desaturate Colors Plugin for Figma

The "True Desaturate Colors" plugin for Figma is designed for genuine color desaturation, ensuring that your designs aren't just overlaid with a grayscale mask but are genuinely converted to grayscale. All hues and saturations within a selected frame or group are authentically stripped, retaining only their brightness values. Whether you're checking contrast, crafting wireframes, or seeking a monochrome aesthetic, this plugin offers a genuine desaturation experience, streamlining your design workflow.


Features:

  1. Authentic Desaturation: Experience true color conversion to grayscale, devoid of overlay tricks.
  2. Gradient Support: Transforms both solid colors and intricate gradients into their genuine grayscale counterparts.
  3. Selective Application: Desaturate specific frames or groups, providing complete control over your design elements.
  4. User-Friendly: Seamlessly integrates with Figma, offering intuitive controls for designers.


Use Cases:

  • Contrast Analysis: Assess your design in true grayscale to ensure elements have the desired contrast.
  • Wireframing: Convert vibrant designs into genuine grayscale wireframes for clarity.
  • Monochrome Design: Achieve an authentic monochrome look for design projects.
plugins.tagline: Genuine Grayscale, No Overlays

plugins.name: Lissajous Curves
plugins.description:
Lissajous curves, named after the French mathematician Jules Antoine Lissajous, are mathematical visualizations that represent the motion of two perpendicular harmonic oscillations. These curves are formed by plotting the coordinates of points that correspond to the simultaneous values of the two oscillating variables.


The shape and pattern of a Lissajous curve depend on the relative frequencies, phases, and amplitudes of the two oscillations. By adjusting these parameters, a wide variety of visually captivating curves can be generated. Lissajous curves can exhibit symmetric or asymmetric patterns, including ellipses, circles, straight lines, and more intricate looped or spiraling designs.


Lissajous curves have applications in various fields, including mathematics, physics, engineering, and art. They are used for visualizations, harmonic analysis, signal processing, and even in graphical representations of sound waves. In the world of design, Lissajous curves offer an aesthetically pleasing and intriguing element that can be incorporated into logos, backgrounds, illustrations, and other creative projects.


Plugin details:


  • a: This is the frequency of oscillation along the x-axis for the Lissajous curve. The value of 'a' influences the shape and complexity of the curve, determining how many 'loops' it forms in the horizontal direction.


  • b: Similar to 'a', 'b' is the frequency of oscillation along the y-axis. It determines how many 'loops' the curve forms in the vertical direction.


  • delta: This is the phase shift between the two sinusoidal functions that generate the Lissajous curve. By altering the value of 'delta', you can change the relative positions of the curves in the x and y directions, leading to a wide variety of different shapes.


  • numPoints: This is the number of data points used to draw the Lissajous curve. It's effectively the resolution of the curve; a larger number of points will result in a smoother curve, while fewer points will create a more 'stepped' or polygonal appearance.


  • scale: This is a scaling factor that influences the overall size of the Lissajous curve. By adjusting 'scale', you can make the curve larger or smaller without changing its basic shape.

accepted.name: zchry
accepted.description: Zachary

plugins.tagline: Quickly create Lissajous curves for your design projects.

plugins.name: Конструктор иконок для разделов
plugins.description:
Как создать иконки


1. Зайдите в свой аккаунт Figma (кнопка Log in в правом верхнем углу) или создайте новый (Sign up).

2. Нажмите голубую кнопку Open in… → New file.

3. В появившемся окне нажмите Run, чтобы запустить плагин.

4. Добавьте одну или несколько квадратных картинок.

5. Выберите нужную форму иконок — круглую или квадратную. 

6. Нажмите «Сохранить». Готово, иконки появятся в папке «Загрузки».

plugins.name: Quaaant — Sync Design & Dev
plugins.description:
Automate DesignOps


➡️ Handoff your assets, components, and tokens to devs.

➡️ Keep them in sync across your product team and tools.

➡️ Connect design, prototyping, and development with one click.


With Quaaant there’s no more manually exporting, importing, or redoing everything with every change.


How to use Quaaant?


➡️ Create and link assets: Designers can create assets directly in Figma or use Adobe Illustrator and Photoshop, then easily link them into Figma, all within the Quaaant platform.

➡️ Build components and create tokens: Use assets to build components, assign variables to them, and create design tokens in Figma, all while keeping everything in sync with Quaaant.

➡️ Handoff and iterate: Developers can pull assets from Adobe or Figma and use components and tokens from Figma, with Quaaant automating the sync into their development environments.


Integrations


Quaaant integrates with design and development platforms like Figma, Adobe, WordPress, and JavaScript, making it easier to move assets between different phases of product development.


⤴️ Supported source integrations: Figma, Adobe Illustrator, Adobe Photoshop.

⤵️ Supported destinations: Figma, JavaScript, React, Vue.js, Angular, Svelte, Next.js, Nuxt.js, Electron, Gutenberg, Elementor, Divi, WPBakery, Beaver Builder, iOS (Swift, Objective-C), Android (Java, Kotlin, Dart, Flutter), Unity, C#, C++, Go, PHP, Laravel, Python.
plugins.tagline: Automate DesignOps: Handoff assets, components, and tokens, and keep them in sync.

plugins.name: SVG to React / Native / SolidJS
plugins.description:
SVG to React / Native / SolidJS

A Figma plugin that lets you easily optimize and transform multiple SVG files into JSX components.


Features

plugins.name: Mural
plugins.description:
Mural is a collaborative intelligence company. We connect teams to unlock their potential, increasing the innovation capacity of the enterprise. Mural creates a culture of effective collaboration — where everyone is connected, contributing, and empowered to deliver business-driving outcomes.


The Mural Collaborative Intelligence System™ centers around a digital whiteboard collaboration space, where teams work together in real-time or asynchronously. Consulting, innovation, product, information technology, and executive leadership teams collaborate visually with Mural, using guided visual methods and Facilitation Superpowers™ features to connect and innovate.


Joining forces with the LUMA Institute, Mural is also transforming how teams work together with a mission to introduce millions to collaboration design. Mural is trusted by 95% of the Fortune 100, including innovative teams at IBM, Intuit, Microsoft, GitLab, Steelcase, Thoughtworks, and Atlassian.


With a centralized space for collaboration and powerful integrations, Mural synchronizes work across apps for faster, smoother workflows, and extraordinary teamwork. With the Mural plug-in for Figma, export frames to Mural to jumpstart collaboration and streamline cross-team communication during design and content reviews, brainstorming sessions, and prototyping.

plugins.name: Visual Difference
plugins.description:
Compare snapshots of Figma objects to visually compare later as those objects change.


This Figma plug enables you to add and manage snapshots per Figma page using the Visual Difference dialog. Per comparison, you can:


  • Compare baseline and latest versions side by side
  • Quickly switch between the comparison and the original artwork to adjust
  • Quickly visualize which snapshots have differences and which do not
  • Identify when the snapshot was taken and the last time comparisons were run
  • Highlight differences by a scalably transparent overlay or fun party mode
  • Approve of detected differences to replace a baseline snapshot


Building upon how Figma enables you to compare visual differences in a branch of the main file, you can use this plugin to:


  • Conduct visual regression prior to or independent of Figma branching
  • Run comparisons for single objects independently
  • Detect differences caused by updating library assets
  • Inspect and adjust objects rapidly while comparing
  • Discover subtle differences in page mockups


Made by @kevinmpowell and @nathanacurtis of EightShapes LLC.

plugins.name: Trello for Figma
plugins.description:
Import your Trello board directly into Figma


Dynamic elements and "drag and drop" included.


Get started with these three easy steps:

  1. Click the link in the plugin to authorise your Trello account and get an authorisation Token.
  2. Paste the token in the Authorisation token field.
  3. Enter the name of the Trello board you want to import in the board name field. Note: the name of the board must be exact, including spacing and spelling.


The plugin is open source, check out the code here:

https://github.com/thomasbrettell/trello-for-figma-plugin


This is an unofficial Trello plugin, not affiliated with Atlassian

Saturation: Imagine dipping your chosen hue in a bucket of color. With the saturation slider, you control how vibrant and intense the color is. Less saturation gives you a soft, pastel vibe, while cranking it up results in a bold, saturated look.


Lightness: Picture adjusting the brightness of a scene. Lightness lets you move your color up and down the scale, from dark and dramatic to light and airy.

plugins.name: Is it done yet?
plugins.description:
Is It Done Yet? is a simple plugin that enables you to organize frames according to their progress status by adding a tag alongside each name. It also allows you to add a ticket number for further organization.

1) For designers - Quickly communicate the status of their designs and make it easier to mark designs for review and hand over files for development.

2) For developers - Clearly marked files that they can work on, leaving no room for confusion or error.

3) For PM's - know what’s ready to groom

4) For Clients - Reduce confusion and save time on turn-around by letting them know precisely what’s ready for approval

With AssetSheet, you can easily create a sheet of all selected components on the current page. Sync those sheets to Zeplin or any other inspection tool to give developers access to all assets they need nicely organized in a single frame.

How to use it

1. Go to the page you want to create a sheet for
Activate Asset Sheet
2. Set element and frame padding
3. Create the sheet (You can either create a sheet from a selection of components or all components on the page)

Features

✅ Organize all components in a single Frame
✅ Either create the sheet from component instances or master components
✅ Automatically create slices for each end every component
✅ Works with different sized components
✅ Adjust the spacing between elements and frame padding

accepted.name: Christian Konrad

plugins.name: Convert To RTL (Heb + Arb)
plugins.description:
* Update *

Now that Figma supports RTL will flip the text AND also update the text box to support RTL, so next time you will be able to write RTL properly.

Watch demo -> here.


This plugin converts flipped text that contains Hebrew & Arabic letters to RTL.


Arabic support still in testing. Let me know if you find bugs :)


How to use:

  1. Select an object (Frame/Component/Instance/Group/Text) that contains text with Hebrew letters
  2. Run the plugin
  3. The text boxes inside the selected object will be updated


Important notes:

  • The plugin does not support texts will multiple styles
  • This plugin opens a ui window and closes it after it's done converting all the text


Feel free to contact me for any bugs you find.
plugins.tagline: Converts texts to RTL

plugins.name: ResponsiveScreenshot
plugins.description:
ResponsiveScreenShot is a Figma plugin that allows you to easily capture screenshots of responsive webpages on multiple devices simultaneously. Simply provide a URL and select up to three devices to capture the screenshots at once.



Features:

  1. Capture the exact view of a webpage by providing a URL.
  2. Specify up to three devices for simultaneous captures.
  3. Customize device dimensions for more precise captures.


Instructions:

  1. Open the plugin and enter the URL of the webpage you want to capture.
  2. Set up devices or customize screen dimensions as needed.
  3. Click the "Take Screenshots" button to capture the screenshots.
  4. Enjoy!


Limitations:

  1. Please ensure the URL is valid.
  2. Some pop-ups or banners on a webpage might appear in the screenshot.
  3. Webpages that require authentication or login cannot be captured successfully and may redirect to the login page.
  4. For webpages that include videos or animations, the captured screenshot may show a blank area in place of the video.


Feedback or bug report:

email: kevinshiuan.work@gmail.com
plugins.tagline: Capture screenshots of a responsive webpage with URL on specified devices at once.

plugins.name: TokenOS [BETA]
plugins.description:
The TokenOS Figma Plugin is a powerful tool designed to streamline the process of managing design tokens within Figma. It allows you to create, edit, and manage tokens directly in your design files, and extends your workflow to incorporate external tools and platforms for an enhanced token management experience.


Features


Import JSON Tokens

The ability to import design tokens directly from a JSON file offers a versatile and efficient way of managing your tokens. This feature enables you to easily transfer tokens between different platforms or import from other design systems, promoting more collaborative and flexible design workflows. Moreover, if you have an existing token set in a JSON format, you can swiftly migrate it into Figma with this feature, saving time and effort.


Airtable Integration

One of the groundbreaking features of the TokenOS Figma Plugin is its seamless integration with Airtable. This integration allows you to manage, edit, and organize your design tokens in a more structured and data-driven manner using Airtable's user-friendly interface. You can create or modify tokens in Airtable, and then directly import them back into Figma. This integration fosters a more dynamic and flexible approach to managing complex design token systems.


How to Use

Accessing these features is straightforward once you've updated to the latest version of the TokenOS plugin. Inside Figma, open the TokenOS plugin interface and choose the 'Import from JSON' option to upload a JSON file containing your design tokens.

For the Airtable integration, you will first need to export your tokens to Airtable using our dedicated Airtable app. Once your tokens are set up and managed in Airtable, you can import them back into Figma using the plugin.


Airtable Extension: GitHub Repository


If you have an issue to report, go to this link

accepted.name: Martin Molcrette
accepted.description: UX/UI Designer

plugins.tagline: Streamlining Design Token Management. Easily import/export design tokens between Airtable and Figma.

plugins.name: Spreadsheet to Sticky
plugins.description:
Spreadsheet to Sticky is a simple plugin on Figma that generate post its based on rows and columns on a spreadsheet (.xlsx or .xls from Google Sheets or Excel).


With this tool, you can:

  1. Generate Sticky from qualitative feedback from a column.
  2. Visually sort generated feedback via scores (e.g CSAT, NPS), through variables tagged onto each Sticky.
  3. Reverse search from feedback to reveal scores.
  4. Now supports all languages!
  5. Now generates Figjam supported Sticky Notes.


Spreadsheet to Sticky is meant to help Designers and Product Managers reduce the time needed to synthesise and organise qualitative research data from large surveys, when producing research reports. I'm using it personally and I hope it helps you all too.


How to use:

  1. Open plugin on Figma or Figjam.
  2. Locate .xlsx or .xls file on plugin.
  3. Check conditions (remove empty, add tags etc).
  4. Generate Post-Its.


by Yuan Jie

accepted.name: Yuan Jie
accepted.description:
Product Designer/Developer

Making simple tools to help designers design more efficiently. In particular, tools to help visualise big amount of data.

plugins.tagline: Spreadsheet (Google Sheets, Excel) data to Sticky Notes, along with custom variables.

plugins.name: Variables ⇔ CSV (Export+Import)
plugins.description:
Highlights


  1. Export text strings to CSV for bulk editing
  2. Export text strings to CSV and share with developers/translators/copy writers/reviewers
  3. Import edited CSV back to Figma to update variables
  4. Multi-lingual support built-in
  5. Simple CSV format


Supports only string variables





Non English variable values

The CSV from the plugin is encoded with UTF-8 encoding, which can handle most languages written in Unicode.


Some programs, particularly MS Excel, might not open/save the CSV properly when opened normally/directly. Follow below steps if you face issues.


Opening the CSV

  1. For MS Excel: Open a new excel file > Click Data > Get External Data > From text > Select the CSV file > Set file origin to UTF-8 in the wizard.
  2. For other programs, follow similar methods to set the file encoding to UTF-8 before opening the CSV.


Saving the CSV after editing

  1. For MS Excel: File > Save as > Change file format in the dropdown to "CSV UTF-8 (Comma delimited) (.csv)" > Save
  2. For other programs, follow similar methods to set the file encoding to UTF-8 before saving the edited CSV.

accepted.name: Vivek G
accepted.description: Product designer, half developer and everything tech in between!

plugins.tagline: Manage Figma variables on CSV with export/import options. Multi-lingual support built-in.

plugins.name: Theme Switcher
plugins.description:
Are you looking for a plugin that lets you quickly switch between multi-branded style sheets, improves your workflow, and reduces work-time by 25%? Then look no further and install Theme Switcher today.


🔀 Switch between multiple style sets in three clicks

🔁 Sync from Local Style in a single click

✅ Single click Color Theme application

🚫 No need to login to separate platform to manage styles


How does it work? 🤔


Create a new Figma file and create local styles within the file using "+" to add new colour styles.


Name your style using one of the example naming conventions mentioned below:


Option 1

▪️ First, setup Default (brand) Ex: Primary-1, Primary-2, Primary-3..., Text, Feedback.

▪️ Then, set up other brands Ex: Brand2/Primary-1, Brand2/Primary-2, Brand2/Secondary-1, Brand2/Text


*if there is only one colour style, you don't need to add - number ex: Brands/Feedback


Option 2

▪️ First, setup Default (brand) Ex: Default (Brand or Theme name)/ Primary-1/Colour Name, Default/Text (for the single parameter)

▪️ Then, Setup Other brands, ex: Brand2/Primary-1/Colour Name, Brand2/Text (for the single parameter)


3. Select Page or Frame to apply theme.


Here is the demo video to learn more about the plugin usage and how you can create the local styles.


It's open-source and we are welcome any suggestions, commits or issues discussion in GitHub.

accepted.name: MobileLIVE Inc
accepted.description: mobileLIVE is a tech-service provider helping businesses develop products, modernize processes, and enable their people to accelerate  digital transformation.

accepted.name: Zulqarnain Ali
accepted.description: I’m a UI/UX Engineer with over 7 years experience. I’m passionate about to make things simple for designers and for developers.

plugins.tagline: Quickly switch between multi-branded style sheets and improve workflow
